summary: use the new official fhir template
description: when tof creates an export to be used with the fhir ig publisher it uses the old has produced a new official framework/template that should be used for igs going forward
it is not officially published yet but is said to be complete enough to try it out and see how it goes
in testing ive found that its far enough along that we can use it for tof
the changes to tof are primarily the structure of the directory that gets exported for an ig using the html export format
the html publishing package export format is also used by tof during the publish process
the following changes have been made to the export structure there is no more ig.json file it is not an ig.ini file
the ig.ini file is very simple and specifies defaults for almost everything with the exception of the implementationguide.version field which is used as the version property of the ig.ini file

if there is no implementationguide.version specified the ig.inis version property is defauled to the ig field in the ig.ini file should be set to the implementationguide.id field and the extension of the file name for the ig field should match what the export format is selected either xml or json
there is no more framework directory in the export
the pages of the implementation guide are exported in the input/pagecontent directory
the actual resources associated with the ig are exported in the input/resources directory

you can find additional documentation about the structure of the export in the engineering onenote notebook new template these changes to the html publisher export format should also work with the fhir ig publisher which can be tested by running the publish functionality on a previously working ig
i tested it on the implementation guide on the fhir server
additionally some functionality has been added to tof to allow the user to customize the navigation menus that each page of the implementation guide shows up on
for example you can edit a page in the ig and specify a custom navigation menu
when the ig is published the results should show a navigation menu item with that page selected
help documentation in the narrative pages page describes how this works

summary: queuing for implementation guide publishing
description: when the user presses the publish button on the publish screen tof starts a java process called the fhir ig publisher the fip is a fairly resource-intensive process
it can take up to of memory and up to ten minutes to run for some implementation guides
because tof is a application there can be multiple users running the fig at the same time

this has caused problems in some environments when too many figs are running at the same time it takes up all the computing power of the server running it and the server slows to a hault sometimes completely unresponsive requiring a reboot
to solve this problem a queuing system must be established so that only a limited number of figs are running at the same time and the system resources on the server dont get overwhelmed
the number of figs that run in parallel should be configurable
when the htmlexporter.publish is called it should determine how many other publish processes are being executed at the same time
this can be done with a variable to keep track of all the publish processes currently running
when a publish process is completed it should remove itself from the and the next publish process in the should start
if a user presses publish and they have to wait in line of the queue the system should indicate to the user your publish request has been queued
xxx publish processes are ahead of you
when a new publish process starts but the user is still waiting in the queue the user should be informed of the update publish processes are ahead of you
because the and server already have a socket connection queue information can be provided in real time

the user should not be able to start a publish process leave the screen come back and start another publish process once the user has queue a publish process they should not be able to create another publish process until it is done
the user should be able to cancel the publish request if it has not already started and they are waiting in the
